oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Preliminary Report on the Incidence of Laboratory-confirmed Clinical Salmonellosis in Northeast USA Dairy Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cripps, C. J.
Warnick, L. D.
Nydam, D. V.
McDonough, P. L.
Grohn, Y. T.
Reed, K. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Salmonellosis
dairy cattle
subclinical infection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Salmonellosis in dairy cattle ranges from subclinical infections to serious illness. Many studies have assessed fecal shedding. The objective of our study was to determine the incidence of clinical salmonellosis in dairy animals in the northeastern United States.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 154
